title: Here's Who Caused Ethereum (ETH) to Drop Massively - U.Today
summary: Here's who caused Ethereum (ETH) to drop significantly: a whale strategically deposited 25,000 ETH to Binance and withdrew 16M USDT 12 hours later, resulting in a sharp price drop. The whale has a perfect win rate for Ethereum trading, but their recent sell-off contributed to the downward pressure on ETH's price. Approximately 8,000 ETH (worth $14.7 million) remains unsold, and future trading activities could impact the market value of Ethereum. Whales have significant influence on the cryptocurrency market, and retail investors should be cautious and track large wallets to avoid unexpected sell-offs.

title: Joe Lubin: “The SEC has spoken” on Ethereum's Status as a Security or Commodity - Yahoo Finance
summary: Joe Lubin, co-founder of Ethereum and founder of ConsenSys, has stated that the SEC has already made a decision on whether Ether (ETH) should be classified as a security or commodity. According to Lubin, the CFTC views Ether as a commodity, while the SEC has only recognized Bitcoin as such and has not declared Ethereum to be either a security or a commodity. The regulatory decision that Ethereum is not a security is seen as a "forgone conclusion."

title: ConsenSys Chief Joe Lubin Claims It’s A ‘Foregone Conclusion’ That Ethereum Is A Commodity, Not Security - ZyCrypto
summary: Joe Lubin, co-founder of Ethereum and CEO of ConsenSys, claims it is a "foregone conclusion" that ether (ETH) is a commodity, not a security, despite regulatory uncertainty in the US. The Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has classified ETH as a commodity, while the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has deemed other cryptocurrencies as securities. However, SEC Chair Gary Gensler has expressed conflicting views on ETH's status. Lubin references a 2018 speech by former SEC director William Hinman, who declared ETH a non-security, and suggests that Gensler's hesitation to classify ETH as a security is due to personal opinions rather than facts. Industry figures and billionaires like Mark Cuban have criticized the SEC for lacking a clear registration process for crypto firms.

title: Why Did Citadel-Backed EDX List Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, and Bitcoin Cash? - Decrypt
summary: Citadel-backed EDX Markets has listed Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, and Bitcoin Cash due to regulatory clarity. These assets are perceived as commodities by regulatory bodies, reducing legal challenges. The SEC has been cracking down on unregistered securities in the crypto space, but Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Bitcoin Cash have been deemed commodities, while Litecoin is considered a digital commodity. EDX's backers, including Charles Schwab, Citadel Securities, and Fidelity Digital Assets, believe these assets are safe from SEC scrutiny.

title: Mastercard Building Ethereum-Based Blockchain App Store for Regulated Financial Apps - CryptoPotato
summary: Mastercard is launching an Ethereum-based blockchain app store for regulated financial apps, called Multi Token Network (MTN). The app store will provide developers with tools to build new applications, including a private version of the Ethereum blockchain. Mastercard has been investing in crypto this year and has previously offered products such as crypto-linked credit and debit cards, crypto infrastructure, and developer tools. The MTN beta will be available in the UK over the next few months and will be expanded to additional markets later. Meanwhile, the crypto market is retreating from Bitcoin's resistance zone above $30K, with total market capitalization down 1.4% to $1.20 trillion.

title: New deBridge Feature Lets Solana Users Easily Access Any Ethereum-Based Blockchain - CoinDesk
summary:
Sure! Here is a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

New deBridge feature allows Solana users to easily access Ethereum-based blockchains through a link-up with DLN Trade, a decentralized exchange product. This enables trading of any asset on one chain directly to any asset on another without liquidity pool bottlenecks or risks.

title: Fearful of being slashed on Ethereum? Here's a staking service with on-chain insurance. - Blockworks
summary: Chorus One, an institutional staking provider, is partnering with Nexus Mutual to offer on-chain insurance coverage for stakers on Ethereum. This will protect users from potential slashing losses, which can result in a loss of stake or removal from the network. The service will be available until the end of this year through Chorus One's multi-chain staking API, OPUS. Institutions can also integrate OPUS into their products to provide staking services to their customers.

title: ZK Stack developers can now build custom 'hyperchains' on Ethereum - Blockworks
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

ZK Stack, a new open-source protocol, allows developers to build customizable blockchains on Ethereum. The modular framework, called ZK Stack, uses zero-knowledge proofs for layer-2 scaling and can be customized for security, consensus algorithms, and data availability. Developers can choose to decentralize or centralize the sequencer and tailor the data availability mechanism to their needs. The technology enables seamless interactions between decentralized parties and can be used for complex transactions. With ZK Stack, developers can create custom 'hyperchains' on Ethereum, rivaling Optimism's OP Stack.

title: Mantle Network: The Ethereum Layer-2 Solution for Next-Level Scalability - Bybit Learn
summary: Mantle Network, an Ethereum layer-2 solution, offers scalability with up to 5,000 USDT in rewards. Sign up today for a 20 USDT coupon and earn more bonuses.

title: Polygon 2.0 Aims to Provide 'Unified Liquidity' Across Ethereum Scaling Networks - Decrypt
summary: Polygon Labs is launching Polygon 2.0, a major upgrade aimed at creating a unified liquidity layer for Ethereum scaling networks. The new architecture will make it easier to spin up new chains in the Polygon ecosystem and feature a shared bridge to improve interoperability between chains. Polygon 2.0 will also integrate zero-knowledge proofs to improve privacy and lower costs for users. The upgrade is part of Polygon's goal to become the "value layer of the Internet" and contribute to a "digital economy that serves everyone."

title: Ethereum (ETH) Set to Explode if It Follows Bitcoin’s History, Says Crypto Analyst - The Daily Hodl
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is poised to surge if it follows Bitcoin's (BTC) historical price movements, according to a popular crypto analyst. Inmortal, a pseudonymous trader with 194,900 followers, notes that ETH priced at $2,000 is similar to BTC being priced at $6,000 in 2019. Ethereum is currently trading at $1,831 and has been hitting macro higher-lows since the summer of 2022. Inmortal is bullish on the overall crypto market and believes prices will be higher in a year's time. He also provides insights on how to read crowd sentiment correctly, suggesting that high engagement on price-up posts indicates disbelief, while high engagement on price-up posts with greed indicates late investors will be underwater if the market drops 10%.

title: Coinbase's Ethereum Layer-2 Network Base Preps for Mainnet Launch - Decrypt
summary: Coinbase's Ethereum layer-2 network, Base, is preparing for mainnet launch after extensive security testing. Over 100 security researchers participated in an audit contest, finding no major vulnerabilities in the network's code. Coinbase is still reviewing submissions and addressing minor issues. Base is being built in collaboration with Optimism and is expected to launch in 2023. The network aims to improve transaction efficiency and reduce costs on the Ethereum blockchain. Coinbase is diversifying its revenue streams beyond trading fees through subscriptions and services, such as staking, and is developing tools to ensure Base's security.

The expiration could lead to increased volume and volatility in the underlying assets, with potential price movements in Bitcoin and Ethereum. If Bitcoin stays above $30,000, dealers may purchase BTC on spot and futures markets. Investors are advised to approach the markets with caution.

summary: Bitcoin (BTC) price is edging closer to a potential recovery after sweeping Monday's low, with a possible rally for other altcoins including Ethereum (ETH) and Ripple (XRP). title: Exclusive: Fxhash 2.0 Debuts Ethereum Integration and On-Chain Minting - nft now
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

FXHash 2.0 debuts Ethereum integration and on-chain minting, expanding its capabilities and offering artists more options for minting and collecting unique generative artworks. The update responds to user feedback and reflects FXHash's commitment to empowering artists to earn a living from their digital works of art. The platform will now support both Tezos and Ethereum, allowing artists to choose the blockchain that best suits their needs. The update also introduces fully on-chain minting on both Ethereum and Tezos, ensuring that artworks are immortalized fully on-chain. FXHash 2.0 will offer a seamless transition for artists accustomed to the existing tools while expanding their potential reach. The update is expected to be released in late 2023 and will be celebrated with a series of URL and IRL events.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Price Drops Due Whale Selling, Key Levels To Watch - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price dropped by 3% in the last 24 hours due to a significant sell-off by a prominent whale. The whale deposited 25,000 ETH on Binance and then withdrew a significant amount of USDT. Despite this, ETH bulls continue to show strength, with the price forming a bull flag on the 1-hour chart. Two scenarios are possible: a breakdown of the support levels could lead to a price decline towards $1,750, while a breakout from the flag pattern could trigger a price rise towards $2,000. The expiration of over $7 billion in options on Friday could also impact the market sentiment.

title: Ethereum/Bitcoin Ratio Futures to Be Launched by CME. Here's When - U.Today
summary: CME Group is launching Ethereum/Bitcoin Ratio futures on July 31, subject to regulatory clearance. This new contract allows investors to simultaneously invest in bitcoin and ether, streamlining the investment process. The futures contract is cash-settled based on the final prices of Ether and Bitcoin. This innovative product aims to provide a more economical way for a broader clientele to hedge positions and implement trading strategies. CME Group has been expanding its cryptocurrency-related product offerings, including Bitcoin futures launched in 2017 and Ether futures launched in February 2021.

title: Canadian ETF Issuer 3iQ to Work With Coinbase to Offer ETH Staking in Its Funds - CoinDesk
summary: Canadian ETF issuer 3iQ is partnering with Coinbase to offer ETH staking in its funds. This collaboration allows 3iQ to offer its investors exposure to Ethereum's staking rewards, which can generate passive income. The partnership highlights the growing interest in cryptocurrency investing and the increasing adoption of staking as a means of generating returns.

title: Vodafone Opts for Cardano in NFT Plans, Snubbing Major Competitors Like Ethereum, Polygon, and Solana - DailyCoin
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Vodafone, a leading telecommunications company, has chosen Cardano (ADA) as the platform for its upcoming NFT launch, snubbing major competitors like Ethereum, Polygon, and Solana. This development suggests that institutions are starting to recognize Cardano's potential for real-world adoption. Vodafone will launch an NFT collection on the Cardano network, with a focus on providing utility and benefits for its German customers. The move has sparked excitement within the Cardano community, with influencers highlighting the potential for the project to expand to other telecommunications giants.

title: SolarPunk and LunarPunk take center stage at ETHBarcelona 2023 - Cointelegraph
summary: ETHBarcelona 2023, a premier Ethereum conference in Spain, is introducing an innovative format this year, departing from its previous structure. The event aims to create a vibrant and inclusive environment for collaboration and knowledge exchange, featuring talks, panels, workshops, and a hackathon. The conference will showcase the latest trends and advancements in Web3 relevant to sustainability and secure systems, with a focus on privacy preservation. Renowned experts will share their insights on the intersection of blockchain, sustainability, privacy, and security. The event anticipates a remarkable turnout, with 50% of speakers and 40% of attendees being women, emphasizing inclusivity and diversity. ETHBarcelona's goal is to give people the tools to further their knowledge in blockchain technology and build projects that can make an impact on society.

title: Ethereum Co-founder Joseph Lubin Says Eth Is a Commodity - The Coin Republic
summary: Ethereum co-founder Joseph Lubin argues that ETH is a commodity, despite SEC chair Gary Gensler's classification as a security. The regulatory landscape in the US is complex, with the CFTC and SEC having different views on how to classify digital assets. Lubin believes that Ethereum's transition to PoS crosses the line from security to commodity. The upcoming two digital assets legislation could give more power to the CFTC, which has argued that Ether is a commodity. However, SEC chair Gensler has conflicting views, having lectured on classifying cryptocurrencies as securities while also cracking down on the crypto industry as a security. Members of Congress are drafting legislation to clarify the classification of cryptocurrencies, with some echoing the CFTC's belief that Ether and Bitcoin are commodities.

title: Ethereum Price Forms Bullish Technical Pattern But Bulls Losing Strength - CoinChapter
summary: Ethereum price is correcting after a recent increase above $1,900, with the bullish flag pattern on the 4-hour chart. However, the price is losing momentum and could drop to $1,780 if it fails to clear the $1,900 resistance. The next major resistance is at $1,935, and a close above it could lead to a fresh rally towards $2,000. On the other hand, if the price drops below $1,780, it could test the $1,700 support.
